intro: Scabiosa virga-pastoris, commonly known as the shepherd's purse, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Caprifoliaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, pink or white flowers. The plant typically grows in dry meadows and rocky soils, thriving in full sun. It is an annual or biennial species, often found in disturbed habitats. Its common name derives from the shape of its seed pods, which resemble a purse carried by shepherds.
